newsitem.title: USA: U.S. propane records largest April build since '93.
newsitem.headline: U.S. propane records largest April build since '93.

text.p: U.S. inventories of propane recorded their largest April stockbuild since 1993, climbing 6.1 million barrels to nearly 32.2 million as of April 30, 1997, the Energy Information Administration report showed.
The build in this rural home heating fuel and petrochemical feedstock came despite colder-than-normal weather during the month, the late Wednesday EIA report said.
Regionally, inventories were mixed, rising by nearly 4 million barrels in the Gulf Coast and 1.9 million in the Midwest. The East Coast fell by 100,000 barrels, the EIA said.

"While late winter storms were the cause for the unseasonal stock draw in the East Coast during the month, falling petrochemical demand in the Gulf Coast more than offset the decline and contributed to boost U.S. inventories to nearly 7 million barrels above year-ago level," the EIA report said.
The EIA report, which is now monthly for the summer season, added that inventories are expected to remain well above year-ago levels over the next several months.
The next EIA report will be released June 11.
